title: Terry Johnson (footballer)
text:
Terence Johnson (born 30 August 1949) is an English retired professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a> who made 263 appearances in <a href="the%20Football%20League">the Football League</a> for <a href="Darlington%20F.C.">Darlington</a>, <a href="Southend%20United%20F.C.">Southend United</a> and <a href="Brentford%20F.C.">Brentford</a>. He is a member of the <a href="Blyth%20Spartans%20A.F.C.">Blyth Spartans</a> Hall of Fame.
Playing career.
Newcastle United.
A <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a>, Johnson began his career as a junior with hometown club <a href="Newcastle%20United%20F.C.">Newcastle United</a>. He was a prolific scorer for the club's <a href="Newcastle%20United%20F.C.%20Reserves%20and%20Academy">youth and reserve teams</a>, bagging nearly 50 goals. He looked set to make his senior debut for the club in a <a href="Inter-Cities%20Fairs%20Cup">Inter-Cities Fairs Cup</a> third round first leg match away to <a href="Real%20Zaragoza">Real Zaragoza</a> on <a href="New%20Year%27s%20Day">New Year's Day</a> 1969, but passport issues prevented him from travelling with the squad. Johnson failed to make an appearance for Newcastle United and departed the club in January 1971.
Darlington (loan).
With a lack of first team opportunities available at Newcastle, Johnson joined <a href="Football%20League%20Fourth%20Division">Fourth Division</a> club <a href="Darlington%20F.C.">Darlington</a> on <a href="Loan%20%28sports%29">loan</a> in November 1969. He made four league appearances and scored one goal for the Quakers.
Southend United.
Johnson signed for Fourth Division club <a href="Southend%20United%20F.C.">Southend United</a> in January 1971, for a £7,000 fee. He scored 8 goals in 21 games during the remainder of the <a href="1970%E2%80%9371%20Football%20League">1970–71</a> season. Johnson was a virtual ever-present for the next three seasons and helped the club to promotion to the <a href="Football%20League%20Third%20Division">Third Division</a> in the <a href="1971%E2%80%9372%20Football%20League">1971–72</a> season. He won the club's Player of the Year award for his performances in the <a href="1972%E2%80%9373%20Football%20League">1972–73</a> season. He departed the Shrimpers in November 1974, after making 170 appearances and scoring 38 goals.
Brentford.
Johnson signed for Fourth Division club <a href="Brentford%20F.C.">Brentford</a> in November 1974 for a £15,000 fee. He made 110 appearances for the Bees and scored 30 goals before problems with <a href="homesickness">homesickness</a> saw him quit <a href="Griffin%20Park">Griffin Park</a> at the end of the <a href="1976%E2%80%9377%20Brentford%20F.C.%20season">1976–77</a> season.
Blyth Spartans.
Johnson ended his career with a spell at <a href="Northern%20Football%20League">Northern League</a> club <a href="Blyth%20Spartans%20A.F.C.">Blyth Spartans</a>. During the <a href="1977%E2%80%9378%20Northern%20Football%20League">1977–78</a> season, he was a part of the squad which won a <a href="hat-trick">hat-trick</a> of cups and took Fourth Division club <a href="Wrexham%20A.F.C.">Wrexham</a> to a replay in the fifth round of the <a href="FA%20Cup">FA Cup</a>, a match played at <a href="St%20James%27%20Park%2C%20Newcastle">St James' Park</a>. Despite retiring due to injury in January 1980, Johnson returned to the club a matter of months later and finished the <a href="1979%E2%80%9380%20Northern%20Football%20League">1979–80</a> season with a Northern League winner's medal. The <a href="1980%E2%80%9381%20Northern%20Football%20League">1980–81</a> and <a href="1981%E2%80%9382%20Northern%20Football%20League">1981–82</a> seasons brought two more Northern League championships and a number of minor cup wins before his departure during the 1982 off-season. After spell with Northern League Second Division club <a href="Bedlington%20Terriers%20F.C.">Bedlington Terriers</a> during the first half of the <a href="1982%E2%80%9383%20Northern%20Football%20League">1982–83</a> season, Johnson returned to <a href="Blyth%20Spartans%20A.F.C.">Blyth Spartans</a> and helped the club to another First Division title prior to his retirement at the end of the campaign. Johnson was later inducted into the club's Hall of Fame.
